I graduated from the Czech Technical University in Prague, Faculty of Information Technologies and I'm helping my girlfriend with her sweet business www.tartaletka.cz.

What's happened?

In the beginning of 2016, we started to work on an app for collectors (www.fullpast.com), something like e-bay for collectors. Unfortunately, client ran out of money and project was terminated from day to day.

What was our technology stack?

The Fullpast front end is a single page app in React.js, communicating with a REST API written in Laravel(resp. Dingo API). The complete dev stack for front-end is: React.js, Node.js, Webpack, Eslint, Redux, Immutable.js, Flowtype a Gulp.

Backend runs on PHP 7 and Laravel 5.3. Images from collectors are being stored on an AWS S3, cache with Redis, search via ElasticSearch. Automatic deployment thanks to combination of Gitlab CI and Envoyer within zero downtime. The code is covered by unit, integration and acceptance tests. Vue.js.is used in administration.

Whole development was held remotely, project management in Asana, communications via Slack, Skype a e-mail.

Why you should hire us?

We are a harmonized team and we go along well. Together together we are very effective and we would like to carry on this way. It might be a new project you can build up with us or we can be a reinforcement of your current development team.

We are available immediately, we love to code in Laravel and React.

If we could define our dream job, then we would like to work on alife-long global project, where we can fully use our experience and talent. We want to be proud of what we do, so it should be a project with a potential and with the purpose to help people with their problems.

We work remotely, Jakub lives in Prague, Czech Republic (UTC+1) and Jarda is currently working from Thailand (UTC+6).
